title: Aluminum rose to 2,814.85 USD/T on November 24, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices increased to 2,814.85 USD per ton on November 24, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day. Despite a 2.13% drop over the past month, prices remain 5.87% higher than a year ago, reflecting ongoing volatility in the market.

title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cuts Rise Again, Aluminum Prices Hover at Highs
summary: LME aluminum prices opened at $2,802.5/mt and reached an intraday high of $2,817.5/mt on November 25, 2025, closing at $2,813/mt. The market remains in a consolidation phase, with primary aluminum prices showing a narrow-range adjustment trend and downstream demand diverging by alloy type.

title: SMM Daily Inventory of Aluminum Billet in Two Domestic Regions
summary: Aluminum billet inventory in two major domestic regions was reported on November 23, 2025. Prices are expected to move sideways in the 21,200–21,500 yuan/mt range in the near term, with limited downside supported by costs and supply.

title: Aluminum Caps and Closures Market Size, Trends and Regional Data 2025-2035
summary: The global aluminum caps and closures market reached USD 9.79 billion in 2025 and is projected to grow to USD 14.60 billion by 2034. The growth is driven by rising demand for product safety, government initiatives like Make in India, and increased focus on sustainable packaging and recycling.

title: Aluminum Prices Expected to Hover at Highs in Short Term
summary: Aluminum prices are expected to remain high in the near term, with limited declines in scrap raw material supply. The market continues to respond to supply constraints and strong demand.

title: Limited Commissioning of New Projects Leads to Slow Growth in Aluminum Production in 2025
summary: Slow growth in aluminum production is expected in 2025 due to limited commissioning of new projects. The European Union is urging the US to further implement trade measures affecting aluminum production.

title: Aluminum Sheet and Plate Market Report: By Key Players, Types
summary: The latest report on the Global Aluminum Sheet and Plate Market was released on November 25, 2025, covering manufacturers, regions, types and applications. This market analysis provides insights into current trends and key players in the aluminum sheet and plate sector.

title: Aluminum Caps and Closures Market Size, Trends and Regional Data 2025-2035
summary: The global aluminum caps and closures market was valued at USD 9.79 billion in 2025 with projections through 2035. This market report provides regional data and trend analysis for the aluminum closures industry.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since the beginning of November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy leading to lower supply. Demand remains under pressure, with China's construction PMI falling to a record low in October.

title: Stocks of Main Finished Steel Products in China Down 2.5 Percent in Mid-Nov 2025
summary: Stocks of main finished steel products in China declined by 2.5 percent in mid-November 2025, indicating tighter supply conditions and potential upward pressure on prices.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,108 CNY/T on November 25, 2025, up 0.55% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have increased slightly but remain lower than a year ago.

title: US raw steel production is up 0.9 percent - week 48, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending November 22, 2025, was 1.761 million net tons, a 0.9% increase from the previous week. The capacity utilization rate rose to 76.9%, and production is up 9.2% compared to the same week last year. Year-to-date production through November 22, 2025, reached 80.734 million net tons, up 3.3% from last year.

title: US steel demand to firm in 4Q: Gerdau
summary: US steel demand is expected to strengthen in the fourth quarter of 2025, supported by data-center construction and solar project investments. Gerdau reports a strong order backlog in North America, although uncertainty remains for special high-grade zinc demand next year. Market participants are cautious as negotiations for 2026 contracts are ongoing.

title: EU appeals WTO ruling in Indonesia steel standoff
summary: The European Union has appealed a World Trade Organization ruling that found errors in its tariff settings on Indonesian stainless steel imports. This move continues the trade dispute between the EU and Indonesia over steel tariffs, impacting international steel trade relations.

title: December 2024 crude steel production and 2024 global crude steel totals
summary: World crude steel production for 71 reporting countries was 144.5 million tonnes in December 2024, with a total of 1,882.6 million tonnes produced globally in 2024. The report includes top steel-producing countries and global production trends, highlighting stable production since 2020.

title: US urges EU to make tech rules 'balanced' to secure lower steel duties
summary: The United States is urging the European Union to adopt balanced technology regulations in order to secure lower steel tariffs. This move highlights the ongoing trade negotiations and the importance of aligning tech policies with sustainability and trade goals in the steel sector.

title: U.S. commerce secretary Howard Lutnick said the U.S. would address the steel and aluminum tariffs on the EU if it first rethinks its digital ...
summary: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick indicated that the U.S. is prepared to address steel and aluminum tariffs with the EU, contingent on the EU revising its digital policies. This reflects the intersection of trade, technology, and sustainability in the global steel industry.

title: Codelco to Partner with India's Adani Group, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing at $10,781.5/mt, up 0.03%. Supply-side arrivals decreased, while state-owned supply replenished normally. Demand weakened after the rebound, and Chinese inventories dropped by 13,900 mt WoW.

title: Copper Stabilizes on Dovish Fed Bets
summary: Copper prices steadied around $5 per pound, supported by dovish comments from a senior US Federal Reserve official and expectations for a rate cut. Supply concerns were highlighted by Codelco's record premium and Freeport McMoRan's production update.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper rose to 5.04 USD/lb on November 25, up 1.04% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 1.88%, but remain 24.33% higher than a year ago. The all-time high was reached in July 2025.

title: Copper slips, US rate cut hopes support sentiment
summary: Benchmark copper on the LME was down 0.3% at $10,749/mt, but sentiment was supported by hopes for a US rate cut. The price had previously hit a record high of $11,200/mt.

title: UBS Forecasts Continued Copper Price Surge
summary: UBS has raised its copper price forecasts for 2026, citing tightening supply due to mine disruptions and strong demand from electrification and clean-energy investments. The bank now expects a market deficit of 230,000 tonnes in 2025 and 407,000 tonnes in 2026, with prices projected to reach $13,000 per tonne by December 2026.

title: Chinese Copper Smelters to Face Record Low Fees for 2026
summary: Chinese copper smelters are expected to accept record low processing fees for 2026 due to ongoing global ore shortages and intense competition for raw materials. This reflects the continued strain on supply chains and the challenges facing new and existing smelting operations.

title: Arizona Copper and Gold Ltd. and Core Nickel Corp. Provide Update on Reverse Takeover Transaction and Concurrent Financing
summary: Arizona Copper and Gold Ltd. and Core Nickel Corp. announced updates on their reverse takeover transaction and concurrent financing, with the closing scheduled for November 25, 2025. The companies expect to issue an aggregate of shares as part of the transaction.

title: Rewiring a sustainable, clean energy future with copper
summary: Mining companies are adopting responsible practices such as reducing water and energy use, engaging with local communities, and investing in environmental management. The article highlights the growing demand for copper in clean energy technologies and the industry's focus on recycling, resource efficiency, and technological innovation to support a sustainable energy transition.

title: Codelco and NTT DATA Sign Strategic Alliance to Accelerate Digital and Sustainable Transformation of Future Mining
summary: Codelco and NTT DATA have formed a strategic alliance to accelerate the digital and sustainable transformation of mining operations. The partnership aims to leverage digital technologies to enhance efficiency and sustainability in copper production.

title: Copper Alloys Market Trends, Shares, Strategies and Investment Prospects 2025-2030
summary: The article discusses the latest developments in copper alloy technology, including product and process innovations and emerging technologies shaping the competitive landscape. It highlights how innovation and technology trends are driving growth and sustainability in the copper alloys market.

title: Copper RRS 2025 — BHP's reserves base provides 27 years of future output
summary: BHP's copper reserves are projected to support 27 years of future output, with innovations expected to produce 410,000 metric tons of copper cathodes over a decade. The article emphasizes the role of technological innovation in sustaining long-term copper supply for the energy transition.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Continue to Rebound on November 25
summary: Nickel prices rebounded on November 25 with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 118,550 yuan/mt, up 800 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rebound was supported by dovish signals from the US Federal Reserve, which increased market expectations for an interest rate cut in December from 40% to 75%. Despite short-term fluctuations, long-term pressure on nickel prices remains, with the SHFE nickel contract projected to trade between 114,000-118,000 yuan/mt.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell to a four-year low of $15,235 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, pressured by a weaker outlook from the Federal Reserve despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Indonesia is considering reducing its nickel ore mining quota sharply from 272 million tons in 2025 to 150 million tons in 2026 to support prices. The metal's decline is also linked to new supply expectations and a slowdown in electric vehicle sales.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, setting the reference price at $15,075.33/wmt, a slight decrease of 0.44% from late October. Prices for various nickel grades also saw small declines, reflecting ongoing market adjustments amid supply considerations.

title: Value of EV battery nickel second highest on record, cobalt at 30-month high
summary: Spending on nickel for electric vehicle batteries reached the second highest level on record in the three months ending October 2025, totaling $1.71 billion. Despite recent price slumps, nickel sulphate prices remain elevated, supporting demand in the EV supply chain. Cobalt spending also surged, driven by shifts in battery chemistry and government stockpiling plans.

title: Major Indonesia Nickel Plant Cuts Output as Waste Piles Up
summary: A major Chinese-owned nickel plant at Indonesia’s Morawali Industrial Park is reducing production due to its tailings storage nearing capacity, highlighting ongoing waste management challenges in the rapidly expanding nickel sector. The reduction is expected to last at least two weeks while new storage solutions are processed.

title: Major Indonesia Nickel Plant Cuts Output as Waste Piles Up
summary: Indonesia’s largest nickel site, Morawali Industrial Park, is experiencing reduced output at a key plant due to full tailings storage, with paperwork for new storage still pending. The situation underscores the environmental and logistical pressures facing Indonesia’s dominant nickel industry.

title: Canada Nickel Announces Bought Deal Private Placement is Oversubscribed and Fully Allocated
summary: Canada Nickel Company has announced that its recent private placement offering was oversubscribed and fully allocated, signaling strong investor interest in the company’s nickel projects and expansion plans.

title: PT Vale showcases Indonesia's world-class sustainability, climate-aligned nickel at COP30
summary: PT Vale's Sorowako operations are undergoing significant technological transformation to achieve a 33 percent absolute emissions reduction by 2030 and a 50 percent reduction in carbon intensity of nickel products. The company is implementing innovations such as heat recovery, off-gas utilization, ore dewatering optimization, and electrification of processing infrastructure to reduce emissions while improving operational efficiency.

title: Nornickel upgrades catalyst in Sulphur program
summary: Nornickel has begun replacing the vanadium catalyst in the contact apparatuses at the Nadezhda Smelter as part of its Sulphur Program upgrade initiative.

title: FPX Nickel secures ECOLOGO certification for sustainable practices
summary: FPX Nickel completed ECOLOGO certification between July and September 2025, reflecting robust corporate and field ESG policies and demonstrating commitment to sustainable mining practices.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group in 2024 came from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and aims to continue advancing its responsible industrial model in 2025.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, that uses green hydrogen to replace fossil natural gas in industrial heat treatment processes. This initiative is part of the company's decarbonization strategy and commitment to sustainable steel production using renewable energy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: The Material the Future is Made of: Cogne Begins More Sustainable Steel Production
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is advancing sustainable steel production by planning a pilot plant for green hydrogen at its headquarters in Aosta. The company uses 100% green electricity certified by guarantees of origin and offers high-performance stainless steels designed for hydrogen applications, supporting the energy transition.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali and CVA sign energy release contract
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali and CVA have signed an energy release contract as part of their ongoing efforts to innovate and maximize energy efficiency in steel production. This collaboration reflects the company's commitment to sustainable industrial practices in Italy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Greenland Resources Signs MOU With Italian Cogne for Long Term Molybdenum Supply
summary: Greenland Resources signed a memorandum of understanding with Cogne Acciai Speciali for long-term molybdenum supply. Cogne, a global leader in special and stainless steel production, is involved in strategic partnerships to secure critical raw materials for high-tech steel manufacturing.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion at Fondazione Dalmine in Italy focusing on nuclear energy's role in the Italian boilermaking industry and Europe's energy transition. The company's mill in Italy obtained accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities designed to ASME III standards, demonstrating its commitment to the nuclear supply chain with specialized quality procedures and training.

title: Italy's Prysmian sees stronger U.S. pricing, margins after new copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian, Italy's leading cable maker, expects to benefit from the new 50% U.S. tariffs on foreign-made copper cables, which will increase costs for competitors importing cables from countries like Mexico, India, and Korea. The company, which produces cables in the U.S., anticipates improved pricing and margins in the American market due to this tariff setup, and has upgraded its full-year profit and cash generation forecasts accordingly.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the U.S. 50% copper tariff as a positive development that will strengthen the American supply chain. Following its acquisition of Texas-based Encore Wire, Prysmian is well positioned due to its domestic copper sourcing and vertical integration, which gives it an advantage over competitors reliant on imports.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Prysmian has raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting a historically strong financial performance in the third quarter, reflecting robust demand and operational efficiencies. This positive outlook is supported by favorable market conditions including commodity pricing and tariff impacts.

title: 13:11 PM Italian Expertise Fuels Prysmian Innovation
summary: Innovation remains central to Prysmian's growth strategy as the company aims to achieve over 55% of its revenues from new products and solutions. This focus on innovation supports Prysmian's leadership in the cable industry, including its copper cable segment in Italy and globally.
